#summary Device::SetCurrentDevice()

{{{void Device::SetCurrentDevice(size_t deviceNum)}}}

Sets the current device for subsequent allocation and kernel enqueue operations. The `deviceNum` parameter denotes the cardinal number of the desired device. This modifies the global state internal to the [Device] class. Unless otherwise specified, subsequent instantiations of a [Buffer] or [Image] object or enqueueing a kernel will occur the deviceNum^th^ device after this call.

=Return=

  * None

=Parameters=

  * deviceNum: the cardinal number of the desired device.
